intro: Mesembryanthemum tetrasepalum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, rounded seeds that are dispersed by wind, and it thrives in full sun. Mesembryanthemum tetrasepalum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and vibrant floral display.
